title: Proponents of the Constitution used Shays Rebellion

content.question: In the 1780s, proponents of the new Constitution cited Shaysâ€™ Rebellion as an example in support of which of the following criticisms of the national government under the Articles of Confederation?

choices.label: The national government did not provide sufficient protection of individual rights.
The lack of a centralized judiciary made enforcement of national laws difficult.
States with larger populations were underrepresented in Congress.
There was a lack of a national military power to address security concerns.

content.answer: There was a lack of a national military power to address security concerns.
